Reviews.Title: “A welcoming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: theTroppers
Reviews.Content: Took a few days with my daughter to explore Baltimore. As soon as she spoke to Paul to make the reservation-we knew this was going to be a great place. The staff made us feel so welcomed from the moment we arrived. Free parking is a major PLUS! Hotel Brexton is on the Nation Historic Registry and has been lovingly restored. The property is conveniently located in a lovely section of Mount Vernon and a FREE bus service to the Inner Harbor is right around the corner. You never have to use your car during your stay because you can walk to most museums and attractions or take free bus and water taxis! Our room was lovely, beds super comfy and everything was extremely clean. Free breakfast daily and coffee was available 24/7. Milton and Eboni are true gems in the industry. They recommended several places to try for dinner and each was spectacular. Milton even arranged car service to Supanos and the owner of the restaurant picked us up! We were so pleased that we decided to extend our stay! We highly recommend Hotel Brexton and we WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “1st choice for Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We lucked-out with a Living Social deal for this wonderful hotel and just stayed over Easter weekend. Although the deal is 'subject to availablility', we had no problem getting a room with just booking the day before. Ebony welcomed us warmly and was able to offer us a choice of 2 rooms. We were thrilled with the 5th floor room we got with the spacious bathroom in the turrett. The room itself was also spacious and everything was spotless. The bed is very comfortable with nice linens and the breakfast was fine. This hotel is really a beautiful renovation. It's in a great location. We took the free purple bus to the Inner Harbor and then ended up walking back as it was such a beautiful day. The Brexton would be my first choice of hotels in Baltimore and we look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rdv1978
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked into the hotel and until the time we left, we were always greeted with kind, helpful, and courteous staff. Everyone made us feel really welcomed and comfortable at the Hotel Brexton. They did a great job of renovating the hotel and making it a "cozy" atmosphere. Thank you so much for the bottle of wine. The first day we were there the weather was beautiful. That night my wife and I sat outside an enjoyed a good bottle of wine. The night air was perfect and made for very special time for my wife and I - Thank you for providing an outside patio for us to sit and relax on. Parking was not an issue as the hotel had reserved spots for its guests. We were surprised that there was a bus (free of charge) that we could take to get to the inner harbor and other nearby attractions. A BIG thank you to everyone at the Hotel Brexton who made our stay a welcomed and enjoyable. We look forward to returning for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C-Line1986
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Baltimore, and my boyfriend and I purchased a Livingsocial deal to Hotel Brexton. The hotel is gorgeous, and so charming! From the spiral staircase to the unique floor layouts. When we checked in, we just wanted to stay in the room, rather than exploring the city! On future visits, we will definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property - super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: christie629
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel - beautifully restored! I was a little concerned about parking when I arrived in early afternoon and when I called the gentleman on the phone said to pull up and go in and they would help me out. I did just that and the manager Paul came out and showed me a spot in front. I shamefully told him that I tried to parallel park my new car but I couldn't get in that spot. He offered to try and I obliged and Paul parallel parked my car into that space pefectly. He carried my bag in assisted with my checkin and even carried my bag to my room. Now that is service!! I was impressed! The room was on the lobby floor and just lovely. It was in the corner so my bathroom was round with very high ceilings. Very comfortable room with lovely amenties. Continental Breakfast in lower lobby in the AM - very nice. The only downside is that they have few parking spaces and when they are gone - they are gone. We did have to drive around 4-5 times that evening within a 2 block radius to try and find a space late that evening. Highly reccomend Hotel Brexton!

Reviews.Title: “excellant in every way”
Reviews.Author: will d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 days at the Brexton for the St. Patty day parade in Baltimore. We both couldn't have been more pleased with our choice to stay there. Every employee there was extremely polite,helpful, and just generally cheerful; starting with Melody at the front desk who was kind enough to check us in early and give us information on getting around the city, to Paul the manager who checked to make sure we were satisfied with everything. Our room and the hotel were very clean and well maintained. The continental breakfast area had a nice selection that should accomodate everyone with a great selection of specialty coffee offered in a self service machine. I have already recommended the Brexton to a few friends planning to stay in the area. Will

Reviews.Title: “Only downfall is the parking”
Reviews.Author: ktturner
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless! The staff was superb! As a matter of fact, one staff worker felt so sorry for me (as he watched me drive in circles for 30 minutes looking for parking), he actually came running out and GAVE me his parking spot. That is outstanding treatment folks! Only 6 floors and 29 rooms, which are recently and fully renovated, my only regret is that we had to leave and go back to work! We had a wonderful weekend in Mount Vernon and can't wait to come back! Thanks so much to Paul and the rest of his staff! You're the best!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: miminli
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, modern decor, quiet, and affordable. We stayed here over the xmas holidays and we're very pleased with the accommodations. The location is very central; we were just a short drive from both Hampden and Fell's Point, making it easy to see family. Hotel Brexton was a great discovery!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, good customer service”
Reviews.Author: rebecacristina
Reviews.Content: We went there after almost a year of having a LivingSocial deal and we really enjoyed our stay. When we arrived, we had a bit of a misunderstanding with the owner about needing to have made reservations related to a portion of our LivingSocial deal (spa) but it was all resolved quickly and smoothly. The owner was actually quite nice about resolving the issue and so was the other hotel staff member. Our room was gorgeous, lots of great light coming in. The regular room's "queen bed" is actually much smaller than a real queen bed is, so I was at first concerned. However, it was quite comfortable to sleep in and we ended up having no issues with its size. The bathroom was comfortable, the shower's water pressure perfectly fine. The breakfast was actually quite fantastic - lots of different kinds of cereal and oatmeal, as well as varieties of coffee/hot chocolate and really delicious croissants. As part of our deal, we had a spa deal and dinner deal and all went really fantastically. We were only there for one night but really enjoyed it and recommend it. The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because of the bed size and the little misunderstanding in the beginning. Location is great and, as I said, the staff was kind after all.

Reviews.Title: “Owner is just rude”
Reviews.Author: EL_Intertia
Reviews.Content: Tried for three months to book with our LivingSocial and even said we would pay more for their "premium" room and not only did it end with a null response but we returned our LivingSocial deal which involved them calling the hotel and confirming that they would not let us book. We read up and there was a complaint about the same thing. The owner even told us he was tired of dealing with the LivingSocial people of which whom he signed up with in the first place. I was very frustrated even after offering to pay extra. The owner said it would be %50 a night more and we agreed and when we tried to book with that he wouldn't let us book even then after we agreed to the extra money for the "premium" room. Not a well run business and I can't imagine it being nice to even go too. With such rude owner/clientele I would never suggest this place nor go there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quaint, and clean”
Reviews.Author: Charcoalsketch
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Brexton. I had to arrive before check-time (early morning flight) and the staff was very accommodating and allowed me to access my room when I arrived. The rooms are attractive, well appointed and great value. Very nice staff and eager to help, fun location. I will definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I have EVER experienced!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWVerona_NJ
Reviews.Content: The service provided by the hotel management fits somewhere on the border between spiteful and incompetent. We arrived at the hotel on Saturday at 7 P.M. When we arrived at the hotel the girl at the desk said "I may have good news for you, or I may have bad news for you." She then proceeded to tell me that our two rooms were unavailable, and we were being sent to a hotel approximately 20 city blocks away in another section of Baltimore. She stated that parking would be provided at this new hotel. NEVER ONCE did ANYONE from the Brexton Hotel call us and tell us that there was a problem with our room. They even stated that "WE DIDN'T HAVE YOUR PHONE NUMBER." This was a lie because I made the reservation via phone. When we arrived at our new hotel we were told that the parking was NOT free, and instead we would have to pay 24 dollars per car per night. I called the Brexton Hotel because the package I bought with the Brexton Hotel provided FREE PARKING. When I called the Brexton Hotel they told me the manager PAUL would call me back and take care of it. (IT HAS BEEN 5 days now and PAUL has never returned any of my 6 phone calls) As a result of the fact that NOBODY at the Brexton Hotel told us that our room was no longer available, and the fact that the hotel we were placed in was in another section of Baltimore, we missed out on our dinner reservations on Saturday Night. Furthermore, we booked the Brexton Hotel with guests, and now we incurred approximately 100 dollars worth of taxi fees so that we could reunite with our group and experience Baltimore with them. I have tried to register my complaint with Paul, the manager of the Hotel Brexton Hotel, six different times; however he has yet to return my phone call. We are very disappointed that the Brexton Hotel Hotel has never once called us to apologize for this inconvenience, called us back to discuss this, offered to pay for the FREE PARKING that I had purchased through the online package that was offered, or even had the professionalism to call us ahead of time to tell us that our room was no longer available. I have never seen such awful customer service and I would advise EVERYONE to stay away from this dreadful place. I plan to repost this every single day until I receive a call from a representative of the hotel to discuss this situation.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find !”
Reviews.Author: dtswisscat
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were nice and clean. The location was great for our planned activities. Even though the hotel is undergoing renovations, it was great to see a beautiful building restored and the staff proud of it. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ericie475
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the service from the staff. The hotel was very clean. Rooms are very nice and romantic. Great location in the city all kinds of things to do around the area. Just lovely Me and my wife really enjoyed it there. We will be coming at least once of month

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for theater”
Reviews.Author: Margaret P
Reviews.Content: My sister, 2 nieces and I visited Baltimore this past weekend to see our nephew in "Fiddler on the Roof" at the Lyric. From a very warm reception to a friendly goodbye we enjoyed our visit. The staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are charming, breakfast is fine, and hot drinks available 24/7. We walked to several great restaurants (City Cafe, Marie Louise Bistro, Sammy's Trattoria), and to the Lyric. Nothing was more than a 10 minute walk. Free Circulator bus available every 10 minutes to Inner Harbor. Great trip, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: HappytravellerCork
Reviews.Content: My experience here was satisfactory. The hotel was very clean. The room was European-sized rather than American but quite adeqaute for 1 person. The heating is controlled from reception - you have to contact reception to regulate it - however, this worked out fine as the staff are very friendly, helpful and cooperative. However, I would have liked to be able to open a window to get some fresh air but this was not possible. The TV channels are somewhat restricted. Breakfast was continental as advertised. I would have liked more choice of fruit and cereals. The breakfast area is small - people tend to be falling over each other. The instructions on the coffee/hot water maker are not at all clear. However, I have no serious complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overall wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Nicole K
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend wanted to take me on an overnight trip to Baltimore and told me all I had to do was choose the hotel, I did not want something run of the mill and like somewhere I have stayed before so when I came across the Hotel Brexton It looked perfect, and it was.I am so glad that is where we stayed. It is a beautiful historic building with beautiful rooms with very large bathrooms. Breakfast was just enough and you can start and end your days with lattes from the kitchen.The staff (Milton, Esther, and Paul) were beyond wonderful. They helped us out with everything from calling us to let us know we left our lights on and how to get back to the hotel, offered to call us a cab to taking pictures of us on the beautiful spiral staircase. I would prefer to not be right down town so location was perfect, a little difficult at first to get to but there is free transportation available. I loved staying at the Hotel Brexton and I can't wait to go again. I would highly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: BartandDineen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this hotel. Front desk is always helpful and accommodating. If you need something, just ask. Our son goes to MICA and when we come to visit, it is close to everything. Light rail is very close along with buses. Really nice neighborhood. lots of good food 2 blocks down.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, average”
Reviews.Author: Mad_Jurist
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was pretty nice. The spiral staircase was cute, and the room was fairly nice. The continental breakfast wasn't great. They didn't have anyone available to help if, as happened to me, they ran out of butter for the bagels, and they didn't restock, so the pastries ran out fairly early. It's not the nicest area of Baltimore, but it's close to Penn Station and only about a mile from the Inner Harbor, so it's not a bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Shoopashoop
Reviews.Content: Scheduling was a bit of a challenge at this relatively smaller hotel. Parking was on the street and free with hotel pass. Front desk personnel were courteous and efficient. No one was available to help with bags -- not that we were looking for that but if that's something you value don't stay here. The place was clean overall and boasted a quaint historic quality that we found appealing. Continental breakfast was good. Not much in the way of full service restaurants nearby but there are a few gay bars and antique shops (which we took advantage of). Hotel Brexton is a good value (clean/quiet) for the neighborhood. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes us not return”
Reviews.Author: tundracat1
Reviews.Content: I know, I know. It's my fault that we selected this hotel, but I'm shocked that this is #2 in Baltimore. I can do research all that I want. I don't blame anyone at the hotel, but this place is in a rather seedy area of Baltimore. The impression that is given is that it's accessible to the harbor via the free bus that goes north and south. Well, that's fine and dandy, but it's not that convenient, and I'm pretty sure that there are people that just ride the thing because they don't have anything else to do. I figured that it was in Mount Vernon, an area which we definitely enjoyed. We had a great time at the Walters, and the neat shops near the square. This hotel isn't in the heart of Mount Vernon, and even then, you're far removed from the Inner Harbor. Parking is a bear here as well. The place is a remodeled historical site in Baltimore, and the rooms are relatively new. I would have expected for there to be more character though. I wasn't overly impressed with the size, but I guess that's what you get with an old building. Breakfast wasn't anything spectacular, but it did the trick for us. Staff was alright, nothing special of note though. I don't want to cheapen anything else with this review, but these things weren't the worst of it. Don't stray too far from the hotel at night. I'm not saying that I feared for my life, but we saw some weird things, some of which I'd rather not even mention. Let's just say that I wouldn't walk with my children again. It made us a little weary to close our eyes at night. Do yourself a favor, and check out a hotel closer to the water. We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for the rest of our stay, and while not an ideal location either, it was night and day compared to the location of the Brexton. The Inner Harbor, Harbor East and Fells Point are all great locations! I didn't complain, because it really wasn't the staff's fault. Next time, I'll do my research a little better and not depend on the opinions of others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff. Odd location and high pet fee.”
Reviews.Author: USA_Super_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros: -- The hotel is brand new and very clean. -- Staff is VERY friendly and easy to communicate with by phone or email. -- Was able to park on the street, free, directly out front. -- Gigantic bathroom. Cons: -- No "slider" security bolt from the inside. Seemed obviously missing. -- Location is a few blocks away from where you really want to be. Fine to walk during the day, but I'd never walk there at night (and I lived in Baltimore for 25+ years) -- Pet fee is very high at $50 PER DAY. Maybe per stay, but per day, it simply adds up too quickly to be worth it. I wouldn't stay here with my dog again because of this, esp when the Admiral Fell Inn allows dogs for free. -- It's an old building, so you can hear the hall noise at night, doors shutting, etc. Didn't bother me too much, but I could see it bothering other people. Overall: It was a good night's sleep in a clean room in a historic building. Worth a look if you're in the area, it's certainly more memorable than a regular chain hotel. And the staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but was disappointed value-wise”
Reviews.Author: xiphosuran
Reviews.Content: This is a small, lovely, boutique hotel and a pleasant change from cookie-cutter chains. It has recently been renovated and it shows. I wanted to give this hotel an additional circle because every staff member was superb. We were treated wonderfully, everything was very clean, and the pillowtop bed was so compfy. However, for the price, it lacked in amenities. Our room and bathroom were small (shower, no tub), but appointed beautifully. I was very disappointed that there was no mini-frig or microwave. When you stay more than one night, it's nice to bring back leftovers as well as the lovely pastries to be found at Vaccarro's Italian Pastry in Little Italy. The continental breakfast was pretty punk compared to the spreads I've had at Econolodge's for less than half the price. I was also annoyed at having to pay $3 for a coke. The parking situation is not desirable. There are several free spots right out front if you are lucky enough to get one. However, there is not much within walking distance, so if you leave, you take your chances on a place being there when you get back. It is close, however, to free transporation to Inner Harbor. There is very limited TV selection and you must pay for Wi-Fi on a daily basis. This is not my idea of "deluxe" accomodations, which is what our room was billed as. Within walking distance is a fabulous restaurant called City Cafe. I did not check if it was wheelchair friendly, but I did notice that it has the same kind of outside steps that alot of old Baltimore does - very high.

Reviews.Title: “Historic property - with nice staff, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brexton is an interesting, historic property -- that has been renovated for a hotel with about 30 rooms. We looked at three rooms before settling in -- all were on the small-side, so if roominess is a consideration, bear this in-mind. Bathrooms have showers, but not tubs - the furniture in the room was a bit worn, and food service is limited to breakfast and an automatic coffee machine (albeit, a nice coffee-latte model). At the same time, Hotel Brexton has pluses: free parking spaces are provided (convenient, and unusual in a city), complimentary breakfast is available, and the day-time staff, especially, is helpful and courteous. Recommended if this is the type of property that is sought.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: ScottB10019
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 day stay here last weekend. Perfect location with super clean room and amenities. Make sure to ask about reserved parking because its difficult in Mt Vernon. Esther at the front desk took great care of us upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location with EXCELLENT service”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Baltimore and searched for affordable hotels. Hotel Brexton was rated #2 on Trip Advisor. I contacted the manager to see if they offered a military rate. Mr. Masai promptly emailed me back and offered us a great rate. When we arrived, there was parking right out front. The amenities were excellent, the service was superb and our room was perfect. The location was great too, easy to get to Penn Station, I-83 and right next to Charles Street and great restaurants. We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: Judgementalmind
Reviews.Content: Beautiful area. Perfectly located but a pricey compared to the convince of two other places nearby. I left and went to Abacrombie Inn a 500 feet away which was a lot cheaper and same services, amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: Seitchik
Reviews.Content: Small, quaint, located close to inner harbor and downtown, walking distance from several excellent restaurants on Charles St (we had Afghani food; outstanding). Friendly staff, clean, quiet, wi-fi $10 per day. Good coffee in the room, adequate cold breakfast downstairs. Excellent value for the $$. Elevator is a little slow. Reserved street parking is limited, so reserve a parking spot when you reserve a room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean!”
Reviews.Author: flutewahine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended period of time. Everything was fabulous - the manager, Paul, was extremely helpful in making the arrangements, and the staff was friendly and welcoming. My room was clean and comfortable, and I did not have any problem with hallway noise during my stay. The free cable tv was a nice amenity, as well as the coffee machine available 24/7 in the dining room. A great location if you go hear the Baltimore Symphony for concerts, and an easy walk to the Inner Harbor during the day. Absolutely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: AlaynaNicole
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely #1 on my list. Every part of my experience I will give a smiling "five stars" too! From the time that I called the manager Paul to make a reservation for my mother and I, I felt at home. Paul made us feel extra special by upgrading our room. He also treated us pleasantly and professionally, as a matter of fact all of the staff at the Brexton is fabulous. As for the architecture the hotel is just the right mix of classic and modern. Coffee in all of the rooms is a big plus. Very clean and nice light and great pillows! I will be staying here next time I am in Baltimore and will recommend to friends for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: dcindc2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends and family over the weekend and was a great stay. Unlike the downtown hotels, the Brexton is in a lively neighborhood where you can walk to bars, restaurants and site seeing very easily. Parking is free as well as breakfast. Staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel has been completely renovated and the rooms are unique and well appointed. Great antidote to cookie cutter chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely great deal”
Reviews.Author: Denis S
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for several reasons: 1. Very modern and spacious rooms 2. Excellent price 3. Reserved spaces and street parking for guests (no charge) 4. My room had its own Keurig coffee machine and large HDTV The hotel staff was very helpful and pleasant as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Baltimore and will probably stay here again as I'm working in Baltimore until the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “So much more characterful than the big corporates”
Reviews.Author: Ali274
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Brexton as an alternative to the big corporate hotels near the harbour side and I'm so glad I did. I was in Baltimore for a meeting at the Convention Centre which was a pleasant 25 minute walk away. My room was comfy, clean and characterful, the breakfasts were more than adequate but what made my stay a 5 star experience was the professional and friendly staff...all very personable and helpful. The hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood, the rooms are spacious and overall I think Hotel Brexton represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Nemrak78
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel was...a hidden jewel. Arrived with very low expectations from view of the lobby but that view changed rapidly. The staff was very impressive and friendly. The rooms are very unique and pretty large. Enjoyed the continetal breakfast and chatting with the manager. Added plus is the location of the hotel, great eateries, lounges and museums close at hand. Great place and looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Hinted Gem...Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: r980jb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hinted gem…I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the hotel..I love remodeled Victorian homes and hotels…I was very impressed the hotel’s décor…very warm and cozy feel. I loved that they had a KEURIG in the room. Coffee, tea, juice, and water is available for not additional charge in the kitchen 24 hours….great plus…My room was great and the staff was awesome and very helpful. The only recommendation is that they invest in providing more cable channels. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bethsol123
Reviews.Content: Our stayed was great!!! We loved meeting new people, and the environment, the location is perfect, very close to Penn line station, great restaurants around the area!! everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AF_DC_11
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days here and was very impressed--the hotel was clean, comfortable, tasteful, cozy. I had everything that I needed, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The kitchen downstairs allows for flexibility in food preparation if you don't want to eat out all the time (although there is no stove or oven, but a microwave and all the dishes you need.) The neighborhood is quiet and pleasant. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Rafael S
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel very near nice attractions..... Warning stay away from LEXINGTON MARKET

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: ah4475
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the rave reviews and free parking, but both were disappointing. I booked a king room for my husband and I, and upon our arrival, we found ourselves in a room with 2 double beds. When I asked the woman at the front desk about the mix-up, she was less than apologetic, telling me that the hotel was full and we couldn't be moved to a king room and that the double rooms were actually better because we had our "own fridge." That would have been a real perk if we had any need for one, but we didn't. The free parking was full, so we had to park a ways up the street and walk with our bags. When my husband asked for a toothbrush, he was told they were all out; the guy behind the desk never suggested the possibility of the Rite Aid up the street. The hotel is a 5 minute drive from the Inner Harbor, and is located in a questionable part of town. On the upside, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean, but I would not recommend the Hotel Brexton. The pricetag does not equate the quality.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID”
Reviews.Author: brookontheroad
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel - and it comes staffed by several lovely people! Our room was a beauty, and quiet; everything was clean as a whistle; and the service was soooooo friendly. Surprisingly, the location turned out to be VERY good. Close to great eating in Mt Vernon, and with easy, free access to harbour Baltimore etc on the free CCC buses. The Brexton is not very pricey - so it's great value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeyd140
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton is a European-style inn in a quiet neighborhood setting. Being an Anglophile, I enjoyed the fact that this was Wallis Simpson's childhood home. The room was comfortable with high ceilings & lots of natural light. The bathroom was spacious & all the comments about the pillows are true. We parked right outside the entrance (with a free parking pass) and didn't move the car until we left. It's about a 20 minute walk to the Inner Harbor area but note that it's uphill walking back. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast (enjoyed sleeping in!!) Our only negatives - WiFi was not free. Our room was next to the mechanical room for the elevator. That being said, since the air conditioning was running while we were there, the noises from the elevator blended in. It didn't keep up from having a good night's sleep. The Hotel Brexton is a pleasant change from the usual cookie-cutter hotel chains & we would gladly stay there again if we return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LarNCar
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in Baltimore, we took a break for quiet time. We enjoyed the "boutique" feel of the hotel, and were pleased to be offered a choice of free upgraded rooms (we checked in rather late). The staff was very welcoming and helpful. Our room was spacious and well-furnished, with a great view of city lights. The pillow-top bed and down comforter provided us with restful sleep. We heard normal muffled hotel noises and the occasional siren, but we nothing from the adjacent room, and were surprised to discover that the room was occupied by two small children (we could hear them from the hallway while we waited for the elevator). Breakfast was adequate, not spectacular, but we appreciated the ample bowls of fruit and 24-hour coffee in the lower-level eating area. The small courtyard with potted plants was a great spot for our al-fresco dinner until the rain started. The Mt Vernon neighborhood is very walkable, with many places of interest and free public transportation that can take you to all the highlights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmacarthurVA
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Hotel Brexton after 2 days at a high-end hotel in Washington DC. What a wonderful place to end our trip! The staff was very friendly and allowed us to check into our room early. They were very informative about things to do and see, as we had a few hours to kill before the concert we were seeing. Our room was spacious, spotless, the bed was perfect, and best of all- great pillows! Pillows make all the difference for me and I spent two prior sleepless nights on rock-hard pillows. These were amazing! In fact, I took a short nap when we arrived to test them out. There is a garden terrace where we had drinks after the concert. Hotel Brexton is beautiful inside and out and has so much more charm than some of the chain hotels in the Inner Harbor. Worth the short drive to the main attractions of Baltimore just for the experience! We will stay here whenever we visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great part of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: DickandLou
Reviews.Content: This was part work & part vacation. The hotel is in easy walking distance of some great places to eat & drink plus good access to the Metro & Light Rail. There's also on-street parking if you need it. In addition the staff were great, nothing was too much trouble & they helped us out with anything we needed. If we return to Baltimore (& it is a great City!) we'll definitely stay at The Brexton.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't actually stay here but excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: We had reserved this hotel but due to unforeseen circumstances, we didn't end up keeping our reservation. However, I wanted to write this review to single out the exceptional customer service from the manager, Paul Masai. My emails were always answered promptly and when we had a problem, he resolved it immediately. So...no comment on the actual hotel not having stayed there, but the management was certainly worth a mention.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but....”
Reviews.Author: Donna81Us
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at hotel a few times while visiting our son at college. While the location is convenient and price is reasonable, I have had more than one restless night. The hotel is very old therefore the floors are extremely creaky and the walls thin. Some windows also do not have blinds and the rooms are very bright in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: P-Dub56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brexton is the childhood home of Wallace Simpson, the Duchess of Windsor. This boutique hotel is wonderful and charming. The customer service is great! They were unfailingly friendly and helpful. The rooms are completely modern and well-appointed. The continental breakfast is better than your average hotel chain. Parking can be difficult but the staff came outside and helped us get what we needed within a few short steps of the door. Easily drove to the location in a nice, safe neighborhood. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored, great location”
Reviews.Author: DanielleK723
Reviews.Content: I am a sucker for National Register hotels and this fits the bill. Beautifully restored, but also modern. Great pillows! And a very cool location. If you're into obscure/off-the-beaten-path Baltimore (like we were) you can easily get to those 'hoods. If you like Fells Point, I understand it's not too far. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: walkingaftermidnight
Reviews.Content: We first visited the Brexton last Spring when our daughter was looking at colleges; the friendly service and wonderful ambiance of this hotel impressed us then. When we returned this month to get her settled in at MICA, Paul and his staff went out of their way to make our stay perfect and we were especially appreciative of the referral to Philip Mugo's car service. We will be visiting Baltimore frequently over the next five years and look forward to making the Brexton our "home" each time!

Reviews.Title: “European, simple, chic style in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: sjmegy
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I loved this hotel. Not only were staff courteous (I was greeted with wine and cupcakes) but the room is spotless, quaint and comfortable. The hotel is in a great neighborhood (Mt. Vernon) close to shops and cafes (and more cupcake stores)! I can not say enough good things about Paul and his staff. When I went away for a few hours (expecting to be back sooner) the hotel manager, Paul, rang my cell phone to make sure I was OK. It's more than good service --it's as if you are staying with folks who truly care about you and want the best for your stay. Both Paul and Melody were fantastic. Suggestions about things to do/see, courteous and friendly. I really loved the place and will definitely return when I come back to Baltimore one day. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “historic architectural gem regenerated as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaytee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late July for two nights. Building is on historic register of places for its architectural heritage (also has links with Wallis Simpson, Duchess of Windsor - the woman the British king abdicated to marry in the 1930's). A little way from the harbour area (connections by bus and metro) but close to historic areas and museums/art galleries. In a regenerating area with good restaurants and bars nearby. Very pleasant room, free serve yourslef breakfast in basement area (a touch crowded if everyone arrives at once but perfectly adequate). Very friendly helpful staff. No hotel car park but street parking available.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elonman
Reviews.Content: The Brexton is a very nice remodeled historic hotel in downtown Baltimore. The rooms are very unique and clean. They offer everything you would want such as internet and a nice flat screen TV. I stayed here while taking the bar exam and it was really quiet and the staff was accommodating. It was also nice to have a coffee maker with free coffee in the room. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our #1 Recommendation! Clean, affordable, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: wwchin
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, bedding was nice, comfortable-modern decor, great light from the tall windows and it came with a nice breakfast. The hotel is located in a great part of town, walking distance to great restaurants along Charles St. in Mt. Vernon and the monument. Did I mention the service was excellent? Efficient and amenable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: minnymiddy
Reviews.Content: Whatever Hotel Brexton lacks in curb appeal, it makes up in the warm and considerate check-in staff. We checked in very late on Friday night (after 11pm I think) and the front desk staff set us up immediately with a smile. Our room was beautifully appointed and had extremely high ceilings (very luxurious for a NYer). The iPod dock was a nice surprise and we wound up using it every morning. We didn't take advantage of the complimentary breakfast (even though it went to 10am, we didn't make it out of bed in time) but we did pop down to the breakfast room for juice now & then. It was clean and connected to an outdoor garden patio. The one quibble about our stay was that the door to our room shook every time someone entered the stairwell to go to breakfast. So, the first morning we were there we were woken up every 5 minutes starting at 7am by the door loudly vibrating. We were staying in 3L. I did mention this to the desk staff and they immediately offered to move us. Our schedule prevented us from taking them up on that offer, but Sunday morning we noticed there was far less banging and we were able to sleep in. When we were checking out, the concierge inquired about the noise and said she'd asked the staff to be especially conscious of the door. So nice! It had made a difference. The hotel is very close to Charles St and all it's restaurants & bars. Go to the Brewer's Art for a beer and to Marie Louise for brunch! The free bus (purple line) also drops off/picks up only a couple blocks away. Use that to get to the Inner Harbor/Federal Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Our One Year Wedding Anniversary Stay at Hotel Brexton!”
Reviews.Author: jessvelez21
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay and would come again! You guys are attentive to detail, helpful, clean, and beautiful rooms and layout of the hotel. I will definitely recommend friends and familly to stay at Brexton! Wish you guys were in closer to Philly...lol

Reviews.Title: “Historic Building and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ethogers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is a very nice and clean boutique hotel with spiral staircases and good breakfast bar. It is very close to the Symphony as well as tons of dining on Charles street. We had a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: jforest83
Reviews.Content: The hotel Brexton is the best hotel I've ever been to. It's smack dab in the middle of Baltimore. It has the best walking distance and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Samantha20m
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton is a lovely Historic Hotel of America! The rooms are modern, very spacious and well decorated. What truly made this hotel experience terrific -was all of the staff, from the General Manager to Front Desk to Houskeeping - 5 Star Service!

Reviews.Title: “Most Helpful”
Reviews.Author: fossyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brexton for four nights prior to joining a Christmas cruise. We had a lovely room and the staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. I would recommend anybody going to Baltimore to stay at this hotel. For us Britts the history factor that Mrs. Simpson had lived there was very interesting

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Experience”
Reviews.Author: crgantt
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here when a family member was in Johns Hopkins and it was great! The front desk made us, two people checking in stressed out checking in close to midnight feel immediately at ease. They were calm understanding and respectful. We left out room a mess rushing out to head to the hospital early the next morning. I left my purse and wallet out. Returned to the room everything was put away neat and tidy, none of my belongings were stolen or missing. (I have a close friend who was a stewertist so that was a concern once i noticed i didnt have my things). Once we returned we spent most of the next day sleeping. The hotel was very quiet. The room was beauifully design and the bed was so comfortable; the artechture of building was just as nice as the decore. Cute cute cute breakfast nook with great continental breakfast with coffee, hot cocoa etc. I have never heard of this hotel before my stay and now I can not wait untill I return to Baltimore (under different surcomstances) to have a chance to enjoy a stay there again. Also, parking was perfect, which is a concern when staying in baltimore city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: jagar451
Reviews.Content: What a neat old hotel. Very clean and new inside, yet retains the feel of it's old charm. Spacious room with very tall ceilings and a comfortable bath- though it had shower only it's all we need. Friendly and helpful staff. Smooth check-in and check-out. And though in the city was a quiet stay. In a walkable and safe-feeling neighborhood. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brexton was a gem of a place.”
Reviews.Author: sonicyoga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 1 night at this beautiful, old, charming hotel in the old part of Baltimore and really enjoyed it! The deluxe room was lovely and very clean with large windows, ample storage space, cable tv, and a nice bathroom. We found the hotel spur of the moment online and spoke with the staff and decided to book a room right then and there. Brent and Paul were our first points of contact and they were extremely helpful and friendly. We were also able to take advantage of a voucher for a local gourmet restaurant by the medical school and had an excellent meal there. My husband and i would highly recommend the Hotel Brexton for anyone wanting to enjoy an historic hotel with free parking in a quiet part of town and old warm charm. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND!”
Reviews.Author: Misc22
Reviews.Content: In short, if you look at my history here, although I have stayed in many hotels and resorts I have only taken the time to leave one other review. From the first call i made to reserve our room, to the emails back and forth and the changes i needed to make. The attention my family and I received from the GM Paul was amazing! Our daughter has been studying at MICA for four years and was graduating. After staying there just one night, my only regret is that we did not stay any other time in the four years she was there. I wish i had known. The staff ( Paul, Melody and Ebony) are amazingly sweet and accommodating. The room was spacious and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was just fine. Newly renovated and tasteful decor was just bonus. The polite and caring gestures from Paul and his staff make this a true gem. If we ever go back, this is the only place i would stay. Thank you Paul for your kindness and attention!!

Reviews.Title: “I hope I have a reason to return to Baltimore so I can stay at the Brexton again.”
Reviews.Author: Bari033
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful rehabed building in a historic neighborhood in Baltimore. My room was impeccably clean, very quiet, and comfortable, and the staff was exceptionally helpful and generous. It's an easy walk to the Walters, Peabody, cathedral, and other tourist destinations, as well as to a streetcar that goes downtown, to the stadiums, and BWI (for $1.60). There are lots of restaurants, cafes, and night clubs within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming, unique, and comfortable place to stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: may4222
Reviews.Content: We were so glad we decided to travel a little further away from the harbor to this quaint hotel. It was so much more interesting and unique than the hotels we've stayed at right at the Inner Harbor. Brexton felt like it was in it's own little neighborhood away from the noise of the city. Our room was the cleanest hotel room I've stayed in. The bed was very plush and extremely comfortable. One thing I wish I had specified was having a tub in the bathroom. There was a fairly roomy shower, however. The room decor was not tacky or overwhelming, very modern and relaxing. We also had a pretty decent view of the city from our 5th floor Deluxe King room. Pretty nice breakfast selection, juice, coffee bar machine, etc. I did miss having a soda machine or a snack machine for when we got back late and wanted something to munch on. Great stay, wonderful staff, beautiful hotel! We will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: mqbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April, 2011. We had a standard queen room, which had ample space for two, a high ceiling, TV on the wall (no DVD player), and a clean bathroom with an excellent shower. The only quibble we had was that our room - which was on the ground floor - was right next to a fire-escape staircase which people were using to go downstairs for breakfast. The door is spring loaded and slams! So if you get room L5, bear this in mind... The self-service breakfast is adequate: you can help yourself to small pain au chocolats, Danish pastries, a selection of cereals, some fruit, yoghurt, and a hot drinks machine. Breakfast runs from 7am till 10am but if you get there near 10am you may find all the pastries have gone! There is limited street parking at the Brexton. Parking isn't included in your room fee (add $20 day) and you may find that you need to park a little further away than you want. The day we arrived happened to be the anniversary of the hotel opening so we were given free parking and we were lucky to get a spot right outside the front door, and, fortunately, pretty much all the sites are within walking distance. Inner harbour with all its attractions is about a 20 minute walk. The staff were all friendly, welcoming, and helpful. There is a bit of history about the hotel, too, as it was the childhood home of Wallis Simpson, who you may have come across in the film, The King's Speech. Recommended, then, particularly if you don't mind walking around and aren't that fussed about eating in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to exceed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jerry021
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Hotel Brexton. Paul, the manager, and his staff continue to exceed my expectations. The room was excellent, the service outstanding, and the environment extremely positive. While I was there, they instituted a wine and cheese party/reception on Wednesdays. A nice addition to the already existing fine continental breakfast. I have no negatives about the property, and will continue to stay at the Brexton when I am in Baltimore again. In addition, I highly recommend it to friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “architectural masterpiece!”
Reviews.Author: DGB51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Brexton during the Easter weekend, and found it to be an excellent choice. The hotel is in a quieter, less touristy area of Baltimore than the majority of the Inner Harbor places, but it was very well located for where we wanted to be...... in Mount Vernon, near to Union Station, Station North Arts district, MICA, the Meyerhoff Opera, and a very easy light rail trip to Camden Yards. The hotel was IMMACULATE, the service was superb and efficient, but the very best aspect was the interior and exterior architecture. We took lots of photos of the many unique angles in the room, and the classic spiral stairwell. Interesting tidbit: this building was the childhood home of Wallis Simpson.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a staff like family!”
Reviews.Author: RVARedSoxFan
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 10-day stay in Baltimore, where the Hotel Brexton was my home away from home while my husband underwent major surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital. Paul and the entire team just couldn't have been nicer, more accommodating, helpful, thoughtful and caring. They were my support system during a very tough few days. I cannot thank them enough for their kind words of encouragement and support during my stay. This hotel is fabulous - a gorgeous architectural landmark in the cool Mt. Vernon neighborhood. The rooms are lovely - and they're all different and beautifully appointed. There are in-room Keurigs, but there's also a fancy Van Houtte coffee machine in the lower level lounge area where free continental breakfast is convenient and healthy. There's free street parking right in front of the hotel. Fantastic neighborhood dining gems like Marie Louise Bistro, Brewer's Art, Sotto Sopra, and City Cafe are easily walkable from the Hotel Brexton. We will return in a month for a follow-up appointment with the surgeon, and we will definitely stay at the Hotel Brexton again then, and on future Baltimore trips. I highly recommend this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “For comfort, cleanliness, quality & convenience, stay at the Brexton.”
Reviews.Author: JHudanish
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton has history, class and a great location in Baltimore's Mt. Vernon district. There are a number of charming, old row houses in the immediate neighborhood that have been lovingly restored, which, of course, adds to the charm of the hotel itself. And there are a variety shops and restaurants within a few blocks of the front door. The Brexton's rooms are spacious and clean. And the staff is about as helpful and accomodating as one could wish. There's a certain ambiance about this hotel that makes you look forward to staying there. We have stayed there twice, and we will defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful atmosphere and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on a business trip in this elegantly restored Victorian hotel in downtown Baltimore. The room was restored with a modern touch and was extremely comfortable. The staff were helpful and obliging regarding the smallest detail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: alp204
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Brexton on a quick trip through Baltimore. We were pleased about every part of this stay! It was in a great location and easy to find. Our room was clean, comfortable and very well-decorated. The hotel staff was always very nice and happy to see us. My favorite part was the fantastic coffee bar downstairs all day! When we return to Baltimore, we will without a doubt return to Hotel Brexton!

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Marion64110
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of a hotel before, but I received such outstanding customer service while at the Hotel Brexton that I feel compelled to do so. I recently stayed two nights there while in town on business. My first experience of this was upon my arrival. Upon pulling up to the hotel, I found that all of the on-street parking was taken, so I circled the block in hopes of finding something nearby. However, the "block" turned into many blocks, and soon I found myself completely turned around and unable to find my way back to the hotel. I called the hotel and spoke to Melody, the Assistant Manager, who was so incredibly patient and helpful. She stayed on the phone with me for at least 10 minutes, talking me through how to get back, and pausing with me while I waited in traffic, at stoplights, etc. Once she successfully guided me back to the hotel, the Manager came out to flag me down, move a parked car so I could take the spot, got my suitcase out of the trunk and carried it in, and held an umbrella for me, since it was pouring down rain. Wow! The next night, when I called Melody at the front desk asking for recommendations for seafood, she found an amazing restaurant for me that even offered a complimentary limo! I could have driven, obviously, but this way, I didn't have to navigate to the restaurant, find a parking space, for pay for a valet. What a treat! I had a delightful dinner and really felt like I had treated myself - even though I was there for business. The hotel itself was lovely, too. It's very clean and modern inside, while quaint and charming on the outside. My only complaints and these are very minor was that the bathroom (in room L3) was chilly and drafty) and the housekeeper did not get to my room until I had arrived back to the hotel after being away all day (about 5:00 pm). All in all, though, it was just a superb experience, and I would recommend the Hotel Brexton to anyone. In fact, I plan to stay there whenever I return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable gem in the center of old Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: neillona
Reviews.Content: Who knew? I went to Baltimore to see an old friend (of forty-five years and more). He had formerly lived there and knew his way around. He recommended the Brexton, a small hotel in a lovingly restored old brownstone, with turrets even! The decorating was inspired, the rooms fresh, the staff -- to a person -- helpful and professional. Free parking was available just outside the door. No negatives at all. ( And it helped to know that Wallis Warfield Simpson had once lived there with her mother!)

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel with extraordinary service”
Reviews.Author: DonaElizabet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 5 day business trip. The rooms are fastidiously clean, elegantly decorated, and furnished with nice extras like iPod players and flat panel tvs. EVERY employee I met was kind, courteous, and accommodating 100% OF THE TIME. They recommended a lot of places to eat for us that were within walking distance of the hotel, and their suggestions never failed us. It was a more like a vacation than a business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored Victorian property, easy links downtown, with excellent staff :)”
Reviews.Author: MissTraveller09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brexton for 3 nights in March 2011 and had the best stay in the US so far! We have been using the large chains, Hilton, Crown Plaza, Ramada etc. but this was different,more relaxing, quiet and laid back, it felt like home. We booked one of the smaller rooms, with one Queen bed for 2 people, however this was still a very good size, with two windows in the bedroom and one window in the bathroom, nice views over the city from the 5th floor. The building has been renovated, retaining original features, well lit, very clean, easy to get to the inner harbour area using the free city circulator bus, within walking distance of the main Amtrak station.Staff were exceptional! Very welcoming, it was nice to have a smile when we came home in the evenings, and tips on eating out. The breakfast room and breakfast included was a nice touch, toast, cakes, yoghurts, cereals, fruit, 24 hour coffee. Coffee machines and good quality toiletries in bedrooms, lovely clean cotton sheets and towels. Our room could have done with a blind for one of the bedroom windows if you want to sleep in, as it became bright quite early, and the shower head was fixed, so maybe not so good for shorter people, but those are the only areas for improvement, all else was totally fab!! We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Historic with Modern Amenities”
Reviews.Author: wissels
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an hotel that would enhance a charming getaway in Baltimore; what we found was an inviting staff and well appointed rooms in a beautiful historic building that was close to public transit. It was also very close to a great gastropub: Brewer's Art. We couldn't have asked for more. The staff helped us out on numerous occasions including: giving my sister directions to the hotel and helping her find parking, holding our bags after we checked out for the day, and giving us friendly, sincere advice on what to do in Baltimore. They were so friendly. It was unbelievable. The spaces are not large in the hotel, but the interesting architecture (read: two turrets) and cleanliness make up for it. The continental breakfast was decent. We really enjoyed the coffee maker in the breakfast room, which was made available to us all day. It sounds crazy to like hotel coffee, but this was a huge machine that would make anything you wanted: espresso, mocha cappuccino, or just plain coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Paul951
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton is a historic building with rooms that have modern amenities. The room was very clean with a very comfortable bed, also with an Ipod friendly clock/radio,32" flat screen TV Wi-Fi, and a coffee maker. The rooms are perfect for business or a family. The bathrooms are very chic with a glass sink. The hotel is within walking distance of Maryland Institute College of Art, downtown, and some other food/drinking establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Was impressed, now I'm not at all.”
Reviews.Author: inlovewithtravel
Reviews.Content: I was impressed when I contacted the hotel to get an email back from the General Manager, or so it seemed. I was asking questions about the hotel and was pleased to get a quick response with the information I requested. I even wrote an article about the high level of customer service. Then, it came crashing down. My group was moved to another hotel after I made my reservation. I called to cancel my reservation to which they informed me that online reservations can not be cancelled. Why? It didn't make any sense to me. Making the reservation cost them nothing. They wouldn't budge. Clearly, they think they needed my $127.04 more than I do...and for no service whatsoever. I challeneged the amount with my credit card company. They sent it to dispute and removed the charge from my card. Now, here we are two months later and I received a letter stating that I never contacted them (never do anything by phone I suppose) and they won't let the charge go. So, now they've collected my $127.04 for nothing. Free money to them and the consumer has to take it. With the level of evidence they need from me, I will conceed my $127.04 and look at it as a day of school, educating me to business practices such as this. But know, that I will take every measure and instead of spending my time fighting a charge i will surely lose, I will dedicate my time to the internet where I will find every opportunity to spread the word that this hotel is not concerned with service once money has changed hands. If they need my $127.04 so badly, they can keep it. But then I wonder, why do they need it so badly? My hope is that they will lose more than the $127.04 they charged me through bad reviews and warnings of their business ethics. Bottomline: Be weary of anyone that would reserve a room online with no money back for cancellation. I still don't get it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing friendly helpful service!”
Reviews.Author: Sara19061
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, clean, easy to reach from the Charm City Circulator, and has wonderful service. During our 1 night stay every staff person we met was friendly and helpful. We couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in historic building”
Reviews.Author: marsjanco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The historic-ness of the hotel is apparent in the rooms, the spiral staircase and in the gorgeous outside look of the building. It was great to have free hotel parking available to us, and so close to the shuttle was useful. The hotel rooms were comfortable and nice, and I had no complaints with the bathroom (I know someone mentioned the shower as being too small and uncomfortable but I had no problems and I am NOT a small person at all). The only change I would have made was to have heating in the bathroom. The staff were lovely and courteous. The only thing I would advise is not to go to Baltimore itself in the winter because on a Monday in the rain there is absolutely nothing to do! I also think that the hotel front desk staff could be a bit more knowledgeable about the actual area of Baltimore and the touristy things to do, because although they tried extremely hard to be helpful (and were very helpful) they had not heard of some of the attractions we enjoyed most (like Geppis museum of entertainment). All in all, beautiful hotel in fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful historic hotel with modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: teachmath
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Brexton while taking my daughter to audition at the Peabody Institute. It is located in the Mt. Vernon neighborhood, just a short walk from the institute. It has the combination of historic character ( spiral stair case, bay windows and high ceilings with modern conveniences( new bathrooms, flatscreen TV , I-docks. An attentive staff, continental breakfast, and free parking in front of the hotel. Breakfast was ordinary but convenient. There is an extra charge for wifi. ($10)

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: yetsb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton is a delightful hotel to stay at in Baltimore. The staff was very helpful, attentive and friendly. The rooms were spacious; bathrooms clean and roomy; beds very comfortable. The location was excellent for we were going to a performance at the Meyerhoff Symphony Hall and restaurants were close by. Parking was also not an issue. I highly recommend the Hotel Brexton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: love12345
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend!!!!! Very very clean hotel!!!!!!Loved this hotel, it has a beautiful modern yet historical feel to it. It is in a safe residential looking area, free parking, free breakfast, and extremely clean which was a big big plus. Fully renovated which has given it a modern clean 5 star hotel feel. The hotel staff couldn’t of been any more helpful, they were very nice people. My husband and I have stayed at 5 star hotels in Baltimore before and our stay at the Braxton Hotel was much better. We felt like we were at home the minute we walked in the door. The only complaint is that there was no DVD player, which wasnt even a big deal. Great Great Great trip, one of our best yet. O and the bed was the best I have ever had at a hotel even 5 star ones. I am extremely funny about pillows and these were very comfortable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: joann2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our granddaughter stayed at the Brexton on our way to Virginia and would highly recommend this hotel. It was convenient off the highway and when we came in we were tired and our room was spacious and comfortable for the 3 of us. It had everything that we needed and we felt pampered. The next morning we took advantage of the breakfast before we left for the 2nd part of our trip and we were satsified. We have stayed in many different hotels this year and this one is one of the highly rated for us!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kinghardy
Reviews.Content: In town for the BSO, we chose Hotel Brexton for its proximity to the symphony center. Staff was very courteous and welcoming, the accommodations were perfect, and the location couldn't have been better. Plenty of cafés and restaurants nearby. Looking forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Coffee drinker's paradise”
Reviews.Author: Backbeat70
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel is great, service from staff, quality of rooms and decor. But I have to say that we loved the latte lounge machine that can be accessed all day. A value add on and quite a bit of fun to play with. My wife and I stayed and had a small dog with us (they allow dogs up to 20lbs in weight for a small fee). Great location for a nice short break, that allowed us to travel without leaving our dog behind. Would recommend this hotel with any qualms whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mustangsally1985
Reviews.Content: Found the Brexton online and booked it because it was close to the Opera House. The beds and linens were incredible, the service was great, the decor was modern and very tasteful and the price was just right. Loved staying there and would absolutely stay there again if in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brexton - clean, courteous and close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: willijam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brexton was clean, courteous and close to the action. We attended the New Year's celebrations and were looking for a safe way to enjoy the holiday. The hotel facilities were clean and within an one block walking distance of the clubs and restaurants. We were able to park and enjoy. I know we will return. Thanks, J. Williams York, PA

Reviews.Title: “European style gem”
Reviews.Author: daddo
Reviews.Content: Recently reopened after a complete renovation, the Brexton is a welcome surprise. The hotel is spotless and pleasant. Continental breakfast is acceptable, but could be changed to a European breakfast with ease. Secure parking is several blocks away, but the hotel staff says there have been no incidents with street parking. We were pleased with our room and its contents.

Reviews.Title: “an outstanding property with excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: jerry021
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton does a fabulous job of taking care of its guests. The rooms are well appointed and decorated, the bed very comfortable, the continental breakfast more than adequate, and the staff extremely customer-oriented. I will be staying here for my third time in June 2011 for 8 days and really looking forward to it. The location of the hotel is very convenient to Baltimore sights and has a number of good restaurants in close proximity. It is a great value for the money. I have no negative comments about the experience of staying at the Brexton. Also, the cleanliness of the property is superior.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brexton: a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aroha-Aotearoa33
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Brexton. It is in a historic part of Baltimore, which is great to explore and our room was lovely. Most importantly, the staff were fantastic, so helpful and friendly and made us feel very welcome. We loved staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: VaGenteelman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Mount Vernon area of the city and what a gem! Beautiful newly refurbished building, convienient parking, a very warm reception, nice continental breakfast choices and secure building. Paul greeted us and made us feel welcomed, offered us a second night at a discounted rate. The 4th floor room was very clean and quiet and the bed was so comfortable. A very good deal! I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Boufie
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! The service at the front desk was helpful, courteous and friendly. The room was lovely, nicely appointed, spacious and very clean. The location was perfect, we liked the fact that we were in town but didn't have the normal street sounds, it was very quiet. Only thing negative is that when we got to our room I did smell cigarette smoke. Like the last reviewer, I told the front desk since we didn't want to be charged the $250.00 fine for smoking. The smell wasn't enough to make us change our room - which they offered to do but it was clear that someone had smoked in that room in the past. They also offered to spray the room and we declined. Hmmm...seems to be a common problem...we were on the 2nd floor. Even with that minor issue, we still would stay at the Brexton again when we are visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Mystified by Rave Reviews”
Reviews.Author: brookjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Brexton this past weekend and I have to say I am mystified by all of the rave reviews. If this is #2 hotel in Baltimore, that's not very encouraging. We stayed in a king suite on the 6th floor; I was told when booking was one of the nicest rooms. Well, the room was just okay. It was clean, but pretty devoid of personality, with low ceilings and not much light. It felt like an attic. Everything (the linens, the microsuede couch) seemed relatively new, but still felt outdated, like it had been sitting the clearance bin at Marshall's for three years and finally found a home at this hotel. But, whatever. So it's not the coolest place in the world. I can live with that. What bothered me more was the service. When we arrived I walked into the bathroom and it smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke. I walked out and said nothing about it, but a few minutes later my husband commented on the same thing -- that the bathroom smelled like smoke. Upon check-in I had been given a form that was very explicit in saying that it was a smoke-free hotel and we would be charged $250 for any smoking in the room (which wasn't an issue -- we are nonsmokers and allergic to cigarette smoke), so it was mystifying that there would be any smoke in the hotel. I called down to the front desk and she said she would investigate to see if anyone was smoking in a nearby room. She offered to move us to a smaller room (I can't imagine what that would have looked like), which we declined as the smell seemed isolated to the bathroom. She also said she would "give us" some odor neutralizer for the problem. It seemed she was implying that I should spray down the bathroom myself, though this was never made explicit. I explained that we were leaving the hotel to grab some lunch but that she could feel free to access our room while we were gone to try to solve the problem. When we returned about an hour later, the room smelled strongly of scented fragrance spray, which is very different from "neutralizing" spray. Ugh. It smelled even worse than before. We quickly headed out to our next function, grateful to escape the room. Later that night we came back to our room with a bottle of wine in hand. My husband asked the front desk for a bottle opener and they said they didn't have one. At a hotel. No bottle opener. I mean, are you kidding? A wine opener would cost them less than $10. They suggested he walk over to the bar across the street and ask them to open it for us. She made it sound like this is something that they do all the time (ask guests to go across the street and have their wine bottles opened by the bar) which again begs the question: why don't they simply have bottle openers at the hotel? So, he walked over to the bar and they opened the bottle (though the bartender definitely made fun of him). It was just one the silliest, most mystifying moments of customer service idiocy we've ever experienced. As another reviewer said, the two women who worked the front desk were always pleasant and smiling but they seemed to have no problem-solving skills whatsoever. The lights are on but no one is home. So no, I do not recommend this hotel. I like boutique hotels as a rule and prefer them over chains, as they tend to have charm and a feeling of specialness, but in this instance there was none of the hoped-for charm (except for the exterior of the building, which is quite lovely), and a complete lack of any customer-service known-how. Pick someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “The room was very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: ame81
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly. Room was clean and updated. The bed was extremely comfortable...got a great night's sleep! The hotel offers free parking...it was street parking, but we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous building, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: norabella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and enjoyed myself immensely. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. They printed maps for me and recommended good restaurants nearby and in other parts of the city. They clearly take pride in their hotel. The building is beautiful, and the renovation was well done. The rooms are small, but adequate. Bed is comfortable, the only criticism I have is that the cool arched window does not have a covering, and the huge spotlight from the building across the street lit up the room a bit. I would have liked the room to be darker. The location is great. Very easy to get to the hotel via light rail from the airport, although I did have a hard time finding the hotel until I asked someone. There's also a free city bus shuttle that stops within three blocks of the hotel and can take you to the Inner Harbor and points beyond. I believe that parking in the neighborhood was tight, so I was glad I didn't have a car. Mount Vernon has many nice restaurants and shops, and I felt quite safe walking around by myself.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: saking1013
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its location, which was close to our meeting place, and for the cost. You could have blown us away when we saw the rooms, which were beautifully appointed--bathrooms were very upscale with vessel sinks and great lighting, bedding was terrific, wonderful single coffee makers,--but we really weren't prepared for the staff and service that we received. Paul, the General Manager, takes customer service to a new level, and the rest of the staff clearly follow his example. Where did they come from??? I don't think I've ever--and I have traveled extensively--experienced such personal excellence from staff in a hotel. We needed to have the feather pillows replaced for health reasons and when they couldn't find any (it's a small hotel), they sent out for them. They were delivered by the time we came in from dinner! One small oversight--we did not get our wake up call as requested. Had we been there another night, we would have made sure we asked for it during day hours. Breakfast was good--excellent coffee/cappucino, pastries, fruit, yogurt. If you like small, boutique hotels that don't cost an arm and a leg, this place is for you. Don't let the lobby fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: TT777_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Brexton during our weekend getaway to Baltimore. Our cozy room had a comfy small queen bed, a sofa, and tall windows that provided natural light. We appreciated the following: + Free parking (Though limited, we always managed to find a spot.) + Courteous staff + Neutrogena bath products + Fresh pastries for complimentary breakfast + Contemporary coffeemaker and vessel sink We had the following minor criticisms: - Technical difficulties (Only 1 out of 4 key cards worked for our room. Plus, we kept losing electricity on the day of check-out.) - Small shower (not exactly full-figure friendly) - No fridge or microwave - Occasional noise from other guests

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and class”
Reviews.Author: Garbo25
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here after reading other reviews and throughly enjoyed the time here. Hotel is small and immaculate. Staff is attentive to needs. One suggestion, book a room that does not face Park. Neighborhood still a little iffy, but close enough to downtown and Inner Harbor. Used their town car service coming in from BWI. Even with three changes in arrival time, thanks to airline chaos, the car was ready at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: megan004
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Baltimore to see the sites and tour the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Brexton. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to free public transportation. The rooms are nicely decorated, well kept and clean. The staff was impeccable. Paul, the general manager, was helpful at every turn. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay near the Meyerhoff concert hall”
Reviews.Author: laurels2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Brexton. We went to a concert at the Meyerhoff and the staff recommended a lovely restaurant, Sammy's, which was within walking distance for our dinner. They were helpful and considerate and would cater to any of our needs. I wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Deceitful, deceptive business practices. Nickle 'n dimed and then lied to again.”
Reviews.Author: maxlm2
Reviews.Content: I have never written a formal hotel review before. My experience with this hotel and the fact that I see it on nearly a daily basis has prompted me to write this review.
