Additionally, I like to support locally owned business and I try to avoid chains whenever possible; however, I was appalled by the business practices of this hotel (particularly management). In short, we were told the price for our room for one night would be $79. When I looked at the receipt the following day at home, we had been charged $200 including tax; $79 for the room and $100 for our two dogs, $50 per dog, which was never disclosed to us when we were told that the total cost of our stay would be $79. As our apartment had flooded that night, we would not come to a hotel at 1AM planning to leave at 6:30AM to pay more for the dogs than the cost of the room itself. The full story follows: My girlfriend and I live a few blocks away from this hotel and our apartment had water leaking through the walls, so we had to get a hotel for the night until the apartment could be fixed. The Brexton was only a few blocks away, allowed pets, seemed to be reasonably priced, so we decided to give it a shot. The woman at the front desk was very nice and gave us a slightly discounted room because we were checking in after 1AM when our apartment got flooded. We had our two dogs with us (a chihuahua and a lab) and the hotel reassured us that the dogs were welcome and our nightly rate would be $79. That sounded fine, we handed over the credit card, and we took the room. The room was clean and looked fine, but even at 1AM on a weeknight, we could hear every single sound in the hotel and out on the street. That was irritating at the time, but not that important in the grand scheme of things. In the morning when we checked out at 6:30AM, we were handed an envelope with our receipt inside and quickly left to make it to work on time. It wasn't until later in the day that we realized that we had been charged $200. Each dog had been charged $50, so we had been charged $100 for the dogs. The cost of the dogs was more than the room itself. I clearly regret not looking at my receipt immediately upon checkout, but when we checked in at 1AM with the dogs and were told that the night would be $79 with no additional charges, I believed that. Again, at check-in I told that the dogs were welcome, and there was no mention of any additional charge... or the dogs being more expensive than the room itself. If we would have known that we would be charged an extra $100, we obviously wouldn't have stayed at a hotel for 5 hours when it cost more for the dogs than the room. The day of checkout, we figured we could call management and they would be reasonable and refund the $100. Initially, management understood that had we been made aware of the charges for the dogs, we would not have stayed there, and they agreed to immediately refund the $100. However, after a week, no refund had been made. We checked back with management to see when the refund was going to be made and we were informed that they had changed their mind about refunding the $100 and were only going to refund $50. This experience was extremely frustrating, since we had clearly been deceived, and we absolutely would have never stayed at the hotel if we had known about a $50/night/dog fee. On top of that, management even acknowledged that if we had we been made aware of the outrageous pet fees, we would have gone elsewhere. Then for management to agree to fully refund the extra charges, and then to have a change of heart and still charge nearly twice the cost of the room itself when we were only in the hotel for 5 hours? I'm thoroughly disgusted with the hotel management and even the notion of charging $50/night per dog. I think that policy in itself is designed as a scam, as that is such an outrageously unreasonable charge. I always considered writing a review about this experience and I just happened to walk by the hotel today while walking the dogs and for whatever reason, I just felt the need to write about this. Hopefully this review serves as a warning to other potential victims of this filthy establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel with excellent rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Walker1986
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend brought me here on my birthday, and it was a great choice! I loved the comfy beds and modern decor (even the sinks are cool). It is also located in a safer neighborhood, and very close to the City Cafe, which is excellent. It is outside the Inner Harbor, but very close to everything. I heartily recommend it, just try to get a room in the off-season, otherwise prices are higher end.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel which is a great value as well”
Reviews.Author: obsessiveplanner
Reviews.Content: Receptionists were so sweet and made great restaurant suggestions. Very pleasant, clean, charming-nice renovation of a pretty victorian buidling. Comfy beds, very good free breakfast (pastry/yougrt/fruit mostly), free parking monitored by camera, good security. Highly recommend to those not in need of frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Renovation to an Historic Building”
Reviews.Author: grapebgirl
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and service. Wish the parking situation was better, but otherwise an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristen73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend. I am hoping that the two very young women who covered the front desk for most of our stay were there because management decided to take a weekend off. If not, I don't think this hotel will hold on to such high ratings. They simply seemed clueless as to how to help us with anything that came up. Friendly, courteous, and always with a smile, but absolutely no thinking going on. For instance, we saw on the website that we could request a fridge. We called ahead. We were told that availability was not a problem, but the charge was not known. Fine. Upon arrival, the charge was $20/night which seemed ridiculous, but we had already bought perishables, so we asked that one be brought to the room. Twenty minutes later, no fridge. We asked again at the front desk. They couldn't find it, but would look through the rooms. What they brought was dirty with someone's abandoned freezer pop and some fuzzy black mold. We cleaned it, and plugged it in. I realize now we should have just started complaining more vigorously, or just left. But we thought that a grown-up would certainly show up and straighten us out. Anyway, it is a new hotel and the bed was alright. By the second night we realized the fridge was not working (our milk spoiled). By then we also realized that we were located on the more noisy first floor--even though the hotel didn't seem very full; we had been shown the utility stairs to go down to the continental breakfast--even though that is where the smelly garbage is stored, housekeeping skipped our room--and no one even said "sorry" when we went to see why (just "that should not have happened"), and a few other things of this sort. Small things that didn't seem worth complaining about, but we were still thinking a grown-up or manager type person would show up. Everyone who worked the front desk was pleasant, but none of them seemed to be able to think for themselves. It was very strange. We listed our complaints at checkout, and they said the charge for the fridge would be taken off our bill. I am on the fence as to whether I would go back. I thought the neighborhood was great, the room was fine for the rate charged. And, as I mentioned, we never complained vigorously--it seemed like we were dealing with inexperienced people who had no authority to help us, anyway. It is possible we read the situation wrong, and if one of those people really did have the authority to: get us a better fridge, bring back housekeeping, understand why they should be sorry, etc.--well I am sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for visiting the Real Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Skidrowe3
Reviews.Content: The Brexton is a quirky little hotel, in Baltimore's quirky Mount Vernon area. The area has a strange mix of mostly-restored 19th century Victoriana (the Brexton itself being a premier example), 1970's urban renewal (like the Waxter Senior Center across from the Brexton, or the nearby Myerson Symphony Hall), and modern automobile-oriented uses (parking lots, parking garages, and repair garages). It's convenient to a lot of things. One thing it is not especially convenient to is the Inner Harbor and the convention center. The 15- to 20-minute walk down to these areas is reasonably pleasant, but the "10 blocks" advertised on the Brexton's website is optimistic at best. Unless you are in Baltimore for a convention, or you're particulary fond of the Inner Harbor, though, the distance is no big loss. Mount Vernon has mostly local places--some classically gritty, some classy; some that have been around for eons, others which are new and trendy: bars, restaurants, cultural attractions like the Walters Art Gallery and the Myerson Symphony Hall, educational institutions like the venerable Peabody Conservatory and the hip MICA art college. Mount Vernon has lots of nightlife (notably gay bars, but we also noted a high-end African-American place and many straight drinkeries also), and it's also adjacent to Penn Station (Amtrak). In contrast, the Inner Harbor/convention center area, although pleasant, vibrant, and very walkable, is much less local in character, an invasion of chain restaurants & hotels. The Brexton hotel itself is essentially new, a gut-renovation. The rooms are quietly stylish, within the constraints of a medium-budget Pottery Barn/Crate & Barrel kind of style. My room (#301) and, I think, most of the others, was oddly configured, but spacious, and the furniture laid out well. Interior acoustic separation seemed excellent: I for one did not hear anyone above or adjacent. In contrast, exterior acoustic separation (i.e. the windows) did not seem very good, but then there wasn't a lot of noise to block. The buffet breakfast isn't lavish, but it had all the ingredients I personally want: fresh fruit, cold cereal, pastries, milk, juices, coffee. The coffee, incidentally, is available 24/7, which includes cappucino, mocchiato, latte, etc. Speaking of nourishment, the front desk has free bite-sized candy bars, a touch I really appreciated when I arrived, hungry. The hotel provides a limited number of free parking spaces. This was great for us, since we drove to Baltimore and were visiting family in northern Baltimore City. If you're visiting the main Baltimore attractions--the various museums, restaurants, and entertainments of the Inner Harbor, Little Italy, Fells Point, Federal Hill, Fort McHenry, and Mount Vernon--you'll do well on foot with occasional taxi (water- or standard-) ride. But a car is very useful to take in many others, such as the Poe House, Baltimore Zoo, Johns Hopkins University, the neighborhood of Hampden, or the Baltimore Museum of Art. Baltimore's public transit isn't especially good, and in any case it hasn't been embraced by the middle classes as a means of getting around. My one complaint about the Brexton is that, using floor stop wedges, they keep the doors to the main stair open. The stair is a marvellous spiral, I grant them, a pleasure to view and climb, but there are sound reasons why the law (i.e. fire codes and building codes) require stairs to be separated. I actually removed the wedge and let the door close on our floor before retiring for the night, but it had been reopened by morning. "Service," I suppose, doing as they were told, ignorant of the legal implications.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind hotel”
Reviews.Author: njoku
Reviews.Content: Tomorrow, I shall be staying at the Brexton for the fifth time, two times with family and two times solo. It is beautifully renovated in very modern style in a fine old building. There is nothing ordinary about the hotel. The elevator is small and slow, but I do not mind, but use the lovely circular staircase most of the time. The rooms all look different because of the unusual shape of the building. I cannot say enough about the friendly and hospitable staff, from the General Manager, Paul Masai on down. Being such a small hotel, they now know me. The only downside for me is that the business that brings me to Baltimore usually results in a late check in, so I miss the few parking spots and have to drive a block away to find parking late at night.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawrie67
Reviews.Content: "Historic" has pluses and minuses. If you love a turret with stairs, or your bathroom in a turret (some rooms), or bay windows -- this could be for you. This is NOT cookie-cutter chain motel layout. The interior renovation is contemporary. The historic site designation means that the elevator is minuscule. The unusual shape of the building (sort of a triangle) makes for interesting room layouts. I immediately asked to be moved to a lower floor (from the lovely view up on 5) so that I could avoid the elevator completely. Nice coffee (free latte, chocolate, etc.) in the lower level. Ice is only in the lower level. The Mount Vernon location is off the beaten path, but the free Circulator bus service takes you right to the Inner Harbor (or walk 1 mile).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PetShopGirl65
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of all the great reviews on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed! The room was great, free parking at front of hotel, very nice staff (coffee maker in our room didn't work but was replaced straight away). My only negative point is that the wifi wasn't free. Definitely recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brexton a Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: hotelie70
Reviews.Content: A client and I stayed at the Hotel Brexton for one night in August. I chose the hotel because of its close proximity to the Maryland Tax Court. The hotel opened in March 2010 so the cab driver and dispatcher at BWI was not familiar with the hotel, but I had the address and the driver found the hotel without a problem. We were greeted by a very friendly front desk staff, including the hotel's General Manager, Mr. PauL Masai. The guestrooms were large, well appointed, and very clean. The bed, pillows, and linens were great and my client reported having a good night's sleep, as did I. The complementary continental breakfast in the morning was limited but satisfactory. Great hi-tech cappucino and coffee machine! We ate dinner at Sammy's Tratoria approximately four short blocks from the hotel. Excellent Italian food and decadent bread pudding is a must. I was very pleased with the experience I had at the Hotel Brexton and would recommend it to friends and business associates who plan to travel to Baltimore and don't need to be in the Inner Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful restoration, fun area”
Reviews.Author: mjeeps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with 16 year old daughter, on college tour. The hotel was beautiful, new, clean. Staff is welcoming. There is not a lot of parking that i could see, but when i made the reservation, the staff assured me i would have parking. When i arrived, all the spaces out front were filled, but they made a space for me and the staff even parked my car for me. We were tired after a lot of driving etc and the summer heat. They recommended a restaurant very close by, City Cafe, and we loved it. It was just what we needed, the food was excellent and the atmosphere lively. The A/C in the room was very effective, and not too loud. The complimentary breakfast was just what we needed, simple yet satisfying, and the coffee maker is to die for, all kinds of coffees at the push of a button. I was not familiar with Baltimore, apparently this hotel is in the "gay" part of town, and once i realized that i did notice some of the bars etc catered to that, but it is also an artsy area with shops etc and convenient to both some of the colleges, the highways, and the inner harbor. I felt safe and very happy that this historic building is being cared for. I would definitely come back again. The only thing i did not like was no free wi fi, but there is wifi available. Also found that the fellow guests were friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant room & nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumman
Reviews.Content: We looked for a hotel in the Mt. Vernon area "at the last minute" to attend a wedding. The reception was at the Peabody Library and the "Court" was full. When I asked if they had a recommendation for a nice place nearby they suggested the Brexton. I booked it without looking it up on TripAdvisor on the strength of the referral and the VERY PLEASANT greeting that I was given on the phone by "Paul." Paul offered me a discount better than one available as an AAA member, AARP, etc. When I later checked it out on this site, I saw that it was then #2 out of 71 hotels. I generally have found TripAdvisor reviews to be sound and reliable. I was not disappointed with booking a room at the Brexton. Paul answered questions in advance and kindly said that our room would be ready for an early check-in. It was! The room was a handsome, freshly updated space with the nice bones of an old hotel. Our room on the 3rd floor had high ceilings and a nice bath with a shower. We had a queen size bed with a nice pillow-top mattress, comfy pillows, a nice sofa, desk and flat-screen TV. There was a nice, framed full-length mirror. The only negatives were no safe in the room and there was an unfortunate stain or spot on the carpet that was otherwise clearly quite new and still in very condition. There is no fitness center, etc., but if you are looking for a place with ambiance and charm, the Brexton has it. While we never met "Paul," the rotating shift of folks at the front desk were uniformly friendly & gracious. The free continental breakfast is certainly adequate. Fresh bananas, yogurt and a very nice coffee machine that allows you to choose your preferred brew are nice to have so handy. If the weather had been nicer one could have eaten on a pleasant patio. Parking is limited, maybe no more than 10 or so spaces. (There are only 29 rooms in the hotel.) As we arrived early, we luckily snagged one. I would definitely stay here again and I would recommend to anyone wanting a nice place to stay in "Charm City."

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKC55
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff you gave excellent service. The room was very nicely furnished and very clean. Great location for the Circulator.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: frommissouri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a Sunday-Tuesday at the Hotel Brexton and found it to be a well located and comfortable place to stay at a reasonable rate. Parking wasn't a problem either. We were only 10 minutes drive from the U. Maryland Medical Center where we had to go on Monday, Tues. and Wednesday. The room was clean, comfortable, esp. the bed. My wife liked the setup of the air conditioning which had a nice breeze over the bed. We were able to walk to dinner two nights, once just a short block to the City Diner, and another night a few blocks to Sammy's Trattoria. The neighborhood is quiet and public transportation is just a short walk away if you need that instead of driving. Breakfast was what we usually eat and was adequate. Had a little trouble connecting to the wireless internet with my iPad but managed to work it out.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought possible in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: adamkstorey
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exceeded all my expectations by far. It just opened earlier this year, so it might go downhill in the future, but it was impeccably clean, the rooms were very modern, the bed was comfortable, yet the hotel kept its character as a historic building. There were pictures on each floor of the restoration process - I highly recommend checking out each floor's picture, as it is amazing the change that took place (the picture on the 2nd floor was especially remarkable). The (free!) continental breakfast was very adequate, and the staff were more than responsive to our needs. The only downsides to the hotel was the parking, which was limited (but we had no problem finding a spot each time we left and came back); and the lack of free wi-fi (there was a paying option, but I found a signal from a nearby hotspot for free). Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best value, best service and best hotel in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer92104
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on government rate (regaular rates are much less cheaper than other area hotels though). Ebony at the front desk was exceedingly helpful and pleasant. My boyfriend and I, although our stay was brief, it was awesome and we definitely would have stayed longer if we could. The rooms are HUGE and the bed extrememly comfortable. I plan on returning and staying when back in the Baltimore area again. And I hope Ebony (and if not her then someone as helpful as her!) is at the front desk again!

Reviews.Title: “I liked the bed and breakfast feel of this marvelously renovated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: madrigalistesq
Reviews.Content: If ever I am in Baltimore MD, short term or long term I will use this place! I liked the smallness of it and the staff, so professional yet personable! If you like the large hotel with restaurants and bars in place, do not use this hotel! I had awesome internet access, could carry on business as usual, the Baltimore symphony hall is in walking distance as are other locations for the perfoming arts, e.g., the Peabody Conservatory. If you drive, parking is free and the Hotel has easy access to 395/95. There's a nice grocery store near by and the neighborhood is lovely. I loved the fact that I could bring my small pet to this hotel. She enjoyed it too!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff & wonderfully restored property!”
Reviews.Author: bkt9
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Hotel Brexton on a work trip, and wish I could have stayed longer! The restoration of this property is a perfect blend between original building characteristics and modern touches. The location is also walking distance from a variety of restaurants and businesses--so it was convenient for my meetings, getting to and from Penn Station and experiencing some local Baltimore food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayblossom
Reviews.Content: My family andI stayed at the Hotel Brexton for three nights while in Baltimore for my daughter's wedding. We fould each of the five rooms we had to be extremely clean and beautiful. While they were all different, everyone reported comfortable beds and no noise either from the surrounding rooms or hallways. Paul was extremely patient as I changed our reservations a number of times prior to our visit. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: barryroy
Reviews.Content: We where worried had never been to Baltimore before never stayed at this type of hotel before, it was all new to us. well we loved it. it was just an awesome stay. would recommend to any one!

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL AND SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE!!!! I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: prmebss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and it was the worst experience ever! I often fly from coast to coast and stay at numerous hotels....usually Marriots and Hiltons, but I thought I would take a chance on a local, rennovated hotel such as Hotel Brexton. The room and bathroom was extremely small and didn't look at all like the photographs on the website. The insulation is terrible.....so bad...that I heard every move that every guest made all through the night and didn't get any sleep. I woke up the next morning and couldn't take a shower because I had no water. When I called the front desk they told me to wait a while because other guests are probably showering at the same time preventing me from getting any water pressure. WHAT!!!! Then I contacted the front desk to get a cab and instead of a cab she said they use a contracted driver for their guests at a nominal fee. I reluctantly agreed and told her that I needed to be in a car within 20 minutes to make an appointment. The driver came almost 45 minutes later, making me late for my appointment. After leaving the hotel, I realized that I had left my phone charger in the room plugged in the wall. I called the front desk to request that they mail it and they said there was no charger in the room. After numerous calls to them asking that they check again, I received a call back 2 days later saying they did find the charger in the wall and that they would mail it. 1 week and 1 day goes by and I get an email from Hotel Brexton saying I needed to call Office Depot and pay for the shipping costs. I call Office Depot and they have no idea what I am talking about. I call back to the hotel and speak with Manager Paul Masay and he says that if I don't pay for the shipping costs they won't ship my phone charger. What a complete nightmare!!!! So much for a courtesy to your guests!!!! Every hotel I know would send a previous guest there item left behind at no cost as a courtesy.....not to mention the terrible stay I had there. I guess from now on I will always stay at chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Night in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Lucymwai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I shared a wonderful stay at the Brexton. We enjoyed the night discovering Baltimore. The staff is friendly and professional. The history of the hotel is romantic. Mr and Mrs K

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable with superior service”
Reviews.Author: kate6462
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights, and I was very reluctant to leave. The room was nice and clean and the bed was heaven...I slept like a baby. For me, the best part of the hotel was the friendly and personable staff. They were so kind and attentive, and I felt really taken care of. I will definitely be staying here the next time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: darrling1
Reviews.Content: Safe and secure hotel that is also modern and clean. The staff is very informative and friendly. My meeting attendees loved the service, area and the ambience. The location is great, quiet and cozy. Beautiful historical building with lots of character. Plenty of culture, restaurants and nightlife in the immediate area. The fresh apples are fabulous! :) Darlene

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: PJS7777
Reviews.Content: My daughter arranged a block booking for friends and family attending her wedding in Baltimore this past weekend. From the newly furnished rooms and the gorgeous ambiance of a historic building, to the absolutely amazing hospitality of Paul Masai and his staff -- we could not have had a better venue at which to stay. My own personal requirement was "coffee on tap" -- I was assured it would be there, and it was excellent! REAL coffee! Brexton and its staff go WAY above and beyond the call of duty, and for all the people who write half-way bad reviews about this place, I say -- try getting better value for money, and a more cooperative management (for twice the money and more) before you complain about the extremely thoughtful and extravagant continental breakfast being diminished by those who got there first! Some curmudgeons simply can't be pleased, no matter what ... but those of us who are not, we thoroughly appreciated the simple and genuine and classy hospitality of this establishment. Highly recommended ... this would be my first choice, far and away, if I needed a hotel in Baltimore again. As a PS, I discovered on Day Two the charming terrace around the side of the building, with additional parking on both sides, and the tiny and rich haven it offers before setting out for the day. Go there to discover it for yourself. And enjoy the experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: marco132
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Brexton and enjoyed every minute of it! Fantastic, friendly and helpful staff. Paul (manager) and his staff were very professional. The hotel has been beautifully remodeled. It is in a great location for walking to restaurants, museums, monuments, historic buildings. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Mommyrobbie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at The Hotel Brexton when my husband was hospitalized at Hopkins. While the trip itself was very stressful, the hotel provided a safe haven to relax and regroup after several difficult days. The rooms are lovely and unique. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There are several nice cafes within walking distance. In addition, there is a small courtyard where we were able to unwind and people watch. We will definitely return for a more recreational trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: minnfat
Reviews.Content: Refreshing change of pace from the typical "fast food" hotel chain. Friendly staff, comfortable beds, charming atmosphere. Beautiful refurbished building in Mount Vernon area. Easy parking. My favorite place to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cozy, an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Templeton_4
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton has the homeyness and charm of a Bed and Breakfast, but with the amenities of a hotel. A short walk from a wide range of restaurants and activities in Mount Vernon, it is located near public transportation and is easy to get to. I had a very enjoyable stay and found the Hotel Brexton quiet and relaxing. I would recommend the experience to anyone visiting Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Bright new spot on the Baltimore hotel scene.”
Reviews.Author: SallieF
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brexton is a little gem. Tucked away not far from the MICA (Maryland Institute College of Art), the Opera House and Symphony Hall, this is a great new hotel. Built in an historic building, the Brexton is affordable and full of lovely amenities. I especially appreciated the water as I'm always annoyed when having to pay $5 from the mini-bar. The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch. The owner, Paul, and resident manager, Daniel, are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again.
